about_the_game:
What is Bodyscope?

Bodyscope is not merely a game; however, it offers an interactive experience akin to one. It serves as a professional tool suitable for use by both experts and novices, facilitating the visualization of CT and MRI images in Virtual Reality. Each CT or MRI study comprises numerous 2D scans, which are utilized to construct 3D models in Virtual Reality. The complexity of the construction process increases with the number of scans in the study.

The purpose of Bodyscope is to:


Generate realistic 3D models from real MRI and CT/PET images in VR, enabling easy comprehension of radiology data even without advanced spatial vision.
Enhance understanding of MRI or CT/PET by allowing users to take an active role in learning through interaction with 3D models of real studies, rather than solely exploring cross-sectional or rendered images.

With Bodyscope, users can:

  • Scale models to explore specific body parts in detail;
  • Apply a set of presets, distinct for CT and MRI images, to visualize specific tissues by density;
  • Cut pieces of VR models with special tools;
  • Take measurements of any element;
  • Enable additional lighting features to highlight elements of the interest;
  • Slice the model at any angle to remove interfering structures.

Collaborate with friends or colleagues

Bodyscope has evolved beyond a technology generating hyper-realistic 3D patient data from CTs and MRIs enhancing situational awareness and spatial orientation for medical students and professionals. It now offers a collaborative environment! In collaboration mode, you can interact with your friends, colleagues, or even your physician and view the same VR model together.

How it works

Step 1: Run the converter
It's a simple and intuitive desktop app.
Step 2: Upload DICOM files
Anonymize your MRI, CT/PET study data if needed.
Step 3: View 3D models in VR
Rotate, slice, and adjust contrast for better visualization.
Step 4: Share your experience
Invite other learners to explore 3D models with you in virtual classes if you wish.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10 or higher
  • Processor: Intel i5-4590 / AMD Ryzen 5 1500X or greater
  • Memory: 8 MB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GTX1060 (6GB version) / AMD 400 - 500 series
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 3 GB available space
  • VR Support: Steam VR, Oculus (Meta Quest) 2, Pro or 3 Goggles
  • Additional Notes: Meta Quest Link requires a high-quality USB cable capable of supporting data and power. You'll also want to make sure that the USB cable is at least 3 meters (10 feet) for an optimal and comfortable experience.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10 or higher
  • Processor: Intel i7 4+ gen / AMD Ryzen 5 3600x or higher
  • Memory: 16 MB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA 2000+ series (except 2050 and 3050 not recommended); AMD 5000+ series (except 5500 and 6500 not recommended)
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 3 GB available space
  • VR Support: Steam VR, Oculus (Meta Quest) 2, Pro or 3 Goggles
  • Additional Notes: Meta Quest Link requires a high-quality USB cable capable of supporting data and power. You'll also want to make sure that the USB cable is at least 3 meters (10 feet) for an optimal and comfortable experience.
